name: places/ChIJP4Uv_phZwokRRfgjjXj_MZ4
formattedAddress: 52 E 13th St #3A, New York, NY 10003, USA
adrFormatAddress: 52 E 13th St #3A, New York, NY 10003-4687, USA

originalText.text:
I live in 2418 Olinville Avenue Bronx NY 10467; managed by your company; Topaz... I have been living here since the 80's.... As of recent, NUMEROUS tenants have had their mailboxes broken/popped into and packages stolen right from the mailbox area in lobby. Even packages that were left at their apartment door(s) have been stolen as well. It happened to my neighbor in 5A as well.... Me myself, had a package delivered October 14th 2022 at 11:53am from USPS(I was tracking it. When delivered, it was "Delivered, in or at the mailbox".....NOTHING was in the mailbox or adjacent to it. I got home after work at 6pm, and there was NO PACKAGE. I even knocked on quite a few of my neighbors apts to see if they took it and held it for me. Or considering I wasn't home, maybe the mailman left it with another tenant. All to no avail. Unfortunately I was not able to file a claim with them(USPS) due to the package coming from Canada (it was a Christian Dior Homme Intense Eau de Parfum 5 Fl Oz/150ml. Valued at $146.29). I have ordered numerous times from that Canadian company, as well as others with no theft issues.... I brought it to the attention of our Superintendent, Benny...... He states he has access to the cameras (which the system was recently updated. Thank you Topaz), however ONLY live footage. He states in order to review the footage, he needs a password that Topaz NEVER gave him.... That's absolutely absurd!!! I had worked for C&C Apartment Management for 5 years. And from my understanding while employed there; the Super MUST have the password/access to the cameras in order to go back and review any theft/vandalism/or crime on property... I know you Ladies/Gentlemen are off the weekend and won't be back until Monday.... I called the office and left 2 URGENT messages. The 1st was the description of the situation and the 2nd was my phone number.... Can we please rectify this ongoing issue in our building with haste so we can see the culprit(s) and notify the 49th Precent. Before it continues to happen.... Also, absolute truth; your company is waaay better than the prior management (Sussman). Please don't change my view on that

Thank You Kindly
Anthony Pacheco apt 5E

originalText.text: Do NOT rent or purchase property from this company. They value profits above all else. They will allow serious problems to persist such as no hot water, elevator breakdowns, mice and roach infestations, cracks in the building, leaks, broken cabinetry, and even intruders in their buildings. They do not properly communicate with tenants and only sometimes provide vague "updates" to problems in their buildings. They will raise rent with no upgrades to the building but instead the building is falling apart. STAY AWAY

text.text: Do NOT rent or purchase property from this company. They value profits above all else. They do not properly communicate with tenants and only sometimes provide vague "updates" to problems in their buildings. They will raise rent with no upgrades to the building but instead the building is falling apart. STAY AWAY

originalText.text: So far, they’ve been fine. I’ve had experience with about 6 management companies during my time in New York. I’m relatively hands off when it comes to relying on supers. However, he was here and available on a SUNDAY to let me into my locked apartment. Should they just increase our rent by$25 instead of telling us it’s for water? 100%. Is the building the nicest place you’ve ever set foot in? Far from it. Should you take your trash to the curb instead of putting it in the trash room on your floor and then complaining about bugs? Probably. Should you set foot in the basement to do your laundry? Probably not, but then again, how many basements have you been into in New York that are nice? My guess is not too many. At the end of the day, so far it’s a decent place to live, and I’ll update my review if anything should change.

originalText.text: Complained about roaches in my apartment. Roaches? Yes, switch on the light in the kitchen in the early morning and they are crawling all over the place. In spite of cleaning a lot, I did not get rid of them. The exterminator medicine does work; you can say at all.  Other departments where I could complain, did, but ended up with no results. I wonder if anyone can suggest if going to the court for this types of issues is the last option or leaving the apartment is the only thing you can do.

originalText.text: quite literally the worst realty team to work with. they are extremely unfair and deceiving people. they raised our rent by $1000 and charged us rent for a month in which my roommates roof collapsed on her in her sleep. they are evil money hungry people with no morals or care for their tenants. i’d avoid
